page.title: 01Farmlands in NE Norfolk
page.content: This section is mainly open flat, & arable country, the many fields bordered by hedges & occasional large trees. There are no villages of any size. Meandering streams curve round the SE part, widening out into two small lakes eventually reaching South Walsham Broad. There are several densely wooded plantations on the undulating slopes above the streams. Except for the NE corner near Ransworth, where there are orchards & young tree plantations, the land is intensively farmed. At Ransworth there is a fine church containing a painted screen & an illuminated antiphoner. Eastward lies Malthouse broad, much frequented by holiday crusiers & yachts, where adequate mooring & shopping facilities exist. Nearby a lane leads to a nature conservation centre of great interest.
